poem:
"Notes on Declassification"

Beneath the wide brim of secrecy,
Ink-spilled truths and half-lit obscurities,
Declassification strums on cords of complacency,
Breaching the dam of covert virtue.

Tactical gains, the fleeting pleasure of dominos,
Yet tremors awake on the backstairs of trust,
In the shadows of the CIA's marbled fortress,
A warning whispered in the fading twilight of assurance.
